items.title: How This Museum is Building a 20-Foot-Tall Donkey Kong Arcade Cabinet
items.description: Ever wanted to feel as small as Mario did when confronted by his original, seven-foot tall gorilla nemesis? On Monday, the Strong National Museum of Play shared its new plans to create an enormous, 20-foot-tall Donkey Kong arcade cabinet. Even though it will be close to four times as big as the 1981 original, the\u2026Read more...

items.title: The Walking Dead: Dead City Will Quadruple-Down on Maggie-Negan Drama
items.description: We\u2019re only a few months out from the first of the post-Walking Dead\xa0Walking Dead spin-offs: Dead City, in which Negan (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) and Maggie (Lauren Cohan) search the zombie-filled ruins of New York City looking for Maggie\u2019s kidnapped son Hershel. Given how low The Walking Dead finale\u2019s ratings were, your\u2026Read more...

items.title: Researchers Want You to Walk Around in VR by Acting Like You Really Have to Pee
items.description: Virtual reality headsets now come close enough to fooling your eyes into believing you\u2019re someplace else, but the experience doesn\u2019t translate as well to the rest of your body. Researchers from South Korea\u2019s Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology want VR to be a whole body experience, and have created a way to\u2026Read more...

items.title: Upper Stage of NASA's Artemis 2 Megarocket Is Ready for Tests
items.description: NASA\u2019s Artemis 2 is feeling realer by the minute. The next upper stage of the Space Launch System (SLS) megarocket is now ready for tests at Cape Canaveral, Florida, in advance of the upcoming mission. Read more...

items.title: Bid Star Trek: Picard a Supersized Farewell by Watching the Finale in Imax
items.description: The end of Star Trek: Picard is nearly here, and Paramount+ is giving the series  a big send-off. Oversized, even: the remaining two episodes of the show\u2019s third and final season (this week\u2019s \u201cVox\u201d and the series finale) will be shared in a special Imax live presentation. Even better, fans will get to see the finale\u2026Read more...

items.title: Everything We Spotted in The Marvels' Totally Cosmic Trailer
items.description: This morning we got our first look at The Marvels, and our first inkling of just how Kamala Khan, Monica Rambeau, and Carol Danvers will be thrust together. But this first trailer also gives us some very intriguing hints about the current state of the MCU\u2019s cosmic side\u2014at least, a little closer to home than what we\u2019ll\u2026Read more...

items.title: 'Better Drugs, Better Health': A Human Genome Pioneer Talks About the Future of Genetics
items.description: Twenty years ago, the Human Genome Project officially wrapped up. It was a feat of collaborative science that took  13 years\u2014from 1990 to 2003\u2014and involved researchers from around the globe.Read more...

items.title: 'Thirsty' AI: Training ChatGPT Required Enough Water to Fill a Nuclear Reactor's Cooling Tower, Study Finds
items.description: Popular large language models (LLMs) like OpenAI\u2019s ChatGPT and Google\u2019s Bard are energy intensive, requiring massive server farms to provide enough data to train the powerful programs. Cooling those same data centers also makes the AI chatbots incredibly thirsty. New research suggests training for GPT-3 alone consumed\u2026Read more...

items.title: How Prime Video's Dead Ringers Tells a New Kind of Horror Story
items.description: David Cronenberg\u2019s 1988 film Dead Ringers set a new standard for twisted twin tales\u2014but Prime Video\u2019s new series adaptation, with Rachel Weisz playing sister versions of Drs. Elliot and Beverly Mantle, the brothers Jeremy Irons played in the movie, carves out its own disturbing place in the genre. Ahead of its\u2026Read more...

items.title: Pentagon Classified Documents Leak Linked to Discord
items.description: After a batch of classified documents were leaked from the Pentagon, it appears  open-source intelligence analysts have pinned the leak down to an unlikely place: Discord. The documents were apparently used by patrons of the messaging platform, which is frequently used by avid video game players, in order to settle a\u2026Read more...

items.title: Can Star Wars Really Make Things Right with Finn?
items.description: Star Wars Celebration 2023\xa0is over, and for the first time in years, we have a solid idea of what the franchise\u2019s cinematic future will be. Read more...

items.title: Binance Searches for Alleged Source Code Leaker
items.description: The world\u2019s largest crypto exchange is on the hunt for a user it says publicly posted the keys to its crypto kingdom. In court documents first filed April 7, Binance asked the court to grant a subpoena against GitHub, trying to find any information about a user whom the company said had leaked excerpts of the Binance\u2026Read more...

items.title: New NASA Official Took Her Oath of Office on Carl Sagan’s ‘Pale Blue Dot’
items.description: When Dr. Makenzie Lystrup was sworn in as the new director of NASA\u2019s Goddard Space Flight Center last week, she didn\u2019t take her oath of office on the Bible or the U.S. Constitution, but rather on a tome revered by space enthusiasts everywhere: Carl Sagan\u2019s Pale Blue Dot.Read more...

items.title: China Will Smash a Spacecraft Into This Near-Earth Asteroid in Planetary Defense Test
items.description: China has selected a small, near-Earth asteroid as the target for an upcoming mission that will help it prepare against future threats of incoming space rocks.Read more...

items.title: Netflix's Mulligan Shows That Rebuilding Earth Takes Some Work
items.description: So many sci-fi stories about alien invasions tend to end with the heroes establishing a safe haven of some kind after the aliens have been defeated or they\u2019ve reunited with their loved ones. But they don\u2019t really get into how you go about rebuilding things after aliens came and messed everything up, which is the\u2026Read more...

items.title: Instagram Founders' News App Artifact Adds 'Reputation Scores' and Comments
items.description: Artifact, the personalized news sharing app founded by Instagram\u2019s co-founders, has added comments and discussion on articles, marking the first public social components of the new app.Read more...

items.title: Why Godzilla Has Returned, Cuter Than Ever
items.description: Godzilla is used to towering over cities and lording his size and strength as the King of the Monsters\u2014but his latest show is a little different. It\u2019s smaller, it\u2019s certainly cuter, and it\u2019s the return of  Chibi Godzilla in a new way: the adorably adult-oriented Chibi Godzilla Raids Again, making its U.S. debut today.Read more...

items.title: Former Twitter Executives Are Suing Elon's Twitter Over Legal Fees
items.description: Twitter\u2019s ex-CEO Parag Agrawal  is suing Elon Musk\u2019s Twitter for the enormous amount of legal fees Agrawal argues he had to pay out of his own pocket. Agrawal is joined by the company\u2019s former Chief Legal Officer Vijaya Gadde and former Chief Financial Officer Ned Segal in seeking repayment. Read more...

items.title: See Dramatic Changes to Waterways After Heavy Rains
items.description: After a series of dry months, England is rainy once more.Read more...

items.title: Sul Sul: Study Mixes ChatGPT With 'The Sims' to Delightful Effect
items.description: At long last, researchers from Stanford University and Google teamed up to answer one of the most pressing questions about AI: Can we make ChatGPT play The Sims? The answer, thank god, is yes (sort of). In a new study, computer scientists whipped up a pixel-art game to test whether you can separate AIs will simulate\u2026Read more...

items.title: Now You Can Pay Thousands of Dollars to Look Like Minecraft Steve
items.description: Your favorite retro games will never look as good as you remember unless you play them on an old tube TV whose analog technology helped to smooth out the pixelated graphics of the 8 and 16-bit gaming eras. Or, you can just embrace the pixelation, which is what fashion label Loewe has done with its new clothing line\u2026Read more...

items.title: Stay Warm Like a Polar Bear With Sunlight-Capturing Fabric
items.description: Bundling up in a puffy Canada Goose jacket isn\u2019t just a fashion statement; the coats are filled with goose down that helps trap and retain body heat when temperatures plummet. But engineers from the  University of Massachusetts Amherst have drawn inspiration from another animal that calls Canada home, and have now \u2026Read more...

items.title: Rahul Kohli Is Now a Warhammer Video Game Star, Already Painting Miniatures of Himself
items.description: Rahul Kohli has made his love of Warhammer well known, from his own model-making journey to championing Henry Cavill\u2019s Warhammer 40,000 series even before Amazon actually went and announced the damn thing. Now, he\u2019s getting his own taste of the 41st millennium\u2019s grimdark future... and he\u2019s already making his own way\u2026Read more...

items.title: Judge Orders Elizabeth Holmes to Trade Mansion for Prison as She Appeals
items.description: After being convicted of wire fraud for her dealings with her failed blood startup Theranos, Elizabeth Holmes was hoping to remain free on bail while she appeals the decision. Unfortunately for her, a federal judge has denied her that luxury.Read more...

items.title: The Human Genome Project Turns 20: Here's How It Altered the World
items.description: On April 14 2003, scientists announced the end to one of the most remarkable achievements in history: the first (nearly) complete sequencing of a human genome. It was the culmination of a decade-plus endeavor that involved thousands of scientists across the globe. Many people hoped the accomplishment would change the\u2026Read more...

items.title: Twitter Is Dead: It's All 'X Corp' Now
items.description: Twitter has been subsumed by billionaire Elon Musk in more ways than one. Now, however, the company itself is officially no longer its own entity, having been officially gobbled up by Musk\u2019s X Corp. It stands as the blue bird app owner\u2019s first official move to reinvent Twitter into a twisted version of its former\u2026Read more...

items.description: If you\u2019re a regular Twitter Circles user, you should probably stop posting things you wouldn\u2019t want seen by the wider public. Numerous tweeters are reporting that their supposedly private Twitter Circle posts are accessible to the whole Twittersphere, letting their more private thoughts or pics loose on the wider\u2026Read more...

items.title: Pentagon Leaks Show Russian Hacktivists Claim to Have Targeted a Canadian Pipeline
items.description: A leaked intelligence briefing that emerged over the weekend seems to reveal a hacking episode carried out by a pro-Russian hacktivist group against a major Canadian gas pipeline.Read more...

items.title: Google is No Longer Supporting These Five-Year-Old Devices
items.description: Google does not plan to update third-party smart displays in the future. If you own any of the Lenovo, JBL, or LG-made smart displays that have come out over the past five years, it\u2019s time to consider alternatives for your Google smart home. Another reason to be wary of being a Google early adopter.Read more...

items.title: Biden Wants to Create a Press Briefing Room for Influencers
items.description: How do you do fellow kids? In an effort to reach younger voters ahead of the 2024 election, President Joe Biden is looking to use social media influencers to tout his accomplishments through an exclusive briefing room. Read more...

items.title: Study Finds Shockingly Fast Sea Level Rise Around U.S. Southeast and Gulf Coast
items.description: Sea level rise is transforming the U.S. coastline across the country, but researchers have noticed that the rate of sea level rise has increased faster in the last decade around the Gulf and Southeastern coasts. Read more...

items.title: What's the Deal with The Mandalorian Season 3?
items.description: The third season of The Mandalorian has felt a little odd, hasn\u2019t it? Dave Filoni and Jon Favreau\u2019s space western slice of the Star Wars franchise felt like a breath of fresh air back in 2019, and the second season the following year helped show that the series\u2019 breakout success wasn\u2019t a fluke. By comparison, season\u2026Read more...

items.title: Strep Throat Is Surging, Alongside an Antibiotic Shortage
items.description: Covid-related precautions helped minimize the spread  plenty of other communicable diseases. But now, those bugs are back, along with some new challenges. The CDC reports that strep A infections (a.k.a strep throat), caused by a bacterium known as A Streptococcus, have surged from covid lows to above pre-pandemic\u2026Read more...

items.title: 10 Horror Movies About Horrifying Pregnancies
items.description: The pregnant protagonist in peril is a go-to horror character at this point. With Prime Video\u2019s upcoming Dead Ringers series putting maternity under a particularly harrowing microscope, we\u2019re looking back at 10 movies that explore the very worst things you can (hopefully not) expect while you\u2019re expecting.Read more...

items.title: Absolutely Everything Announced at Star Wars Celebration 2023
items.description: There was plenty to celebrate at Star Wars Celebration Europe, which wrapped up today in London. The Lucasfilm lovefest wowed fans with all sorts of news, including when the franchise will finally return to movie theaters\u2014and who\u2019ll be directing the new movies. Plus, there were new trailers for Ahsoka, Visions, \u2026Read more...

items.title: Clever Elephant Starts Peeling Her Bananas After Seeing Humans Do It
items.description: Elephant see, elephant do, it seems. In a new paper this week, researchers describe an Asian elephant that has learned how to peel a banana before eating it. The pachyderm, named Pang Pha, likely adopted the trick from watching humans but appears to only peel certain bananas.Read more...

items.title: Cruise and Waymo Self-Driving Taxis Are Terrorizing Transit Operators
items.description: In San Francisco, tech \u201cdisruption\u201d is often framed as good. It\u2019s the goal of \u201cmove fast, break things\u201d start-ups and Silicon Valley entrepreneurs: innovation, paradigm shifts, etc.... items.title: Apple Shipped 40% Fewer Macs in the Start of 2023
items.description: None of the big PC makers have managed to crawl out of the muck of 2022 declines, and new data shows that Apple\u2019s been among the hardest hit. items.title: The Strangest Amber Fossils Ever Discovered
items.description: Amber fossils are like a time capsule, preserving the three-dimensional structure of animals, plants, and other prehistoric items of interest. Every once in a while, however, paleontologists stumble upon some particularly bizarre specimens and scenes.Read more...

items.title: Studio Ghibli Teases Another Star Wars Collaboration

items.description: The SpaceX Starship rocket\u2019s orbital test flight has been in the works for months, but it looks like it might finally be happening  in a little over a week. No, we really mean it this time. Read more...

items.title: Google Pixel 7a Leak Shows a 90Hz Refresh Rate, More Memory
items.description: It\u2019ll be a while before Google reprises its flagship Pixel series. Until then, we have Pixel 7a leaks to tide us over. The latest hints from overseas include a look at the phone itself and hint as to what kind of specs might be inside it.
